title: What has been Christianity's contribution to society during times of plague and pandemics historically? - Practical Faith - Quora

response.answer_text: Have you ever been to a hospital? If so thank Christians. Have you ever heard of clinics and support services for lepers? Christians did that too. A number of Christian saints are known as unmercinary healers, that is they were physcians who treated the sick free of charge. Historically during times of plague, it is groups of christians, often monastics who go amongst the sick and dying to tend to them, even at the occasional cost of their own lives.
